description: Blasius sequence: from coefficients in expansion of solution to Blasius' equation in boundary layer theory.
comments: Number of increasing trilabelled unordered trees. - _Markus Kuba_, Nov 18 2014
references: H. T. Davis: Introduction to Nonlinear Differential and Integral Equations (Dover 1962) page 403.
links: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..180
Markus Kuba, Alois Panholzer, Combinatorial families of multilabelled increasing trees and hook-length formulas, arXiv:1411.4587 [math.CO], (17-November-2014)
formula: E.g.f. A(x) satisfies diff(log(A(x)), x, x, x) = A(x). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 24 2003Limit n->infinity (a(n)/(3*n+2)!)^(1/n) = 0.03269425181024... . - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 28 2014T(z) = log(A(z)) satisfies T'''(z)=exp(T(z)), such that F(z)=T'(z) satisfies a Blasius type equation: F'''(z)-F(z)*F''(z)=0. - _Markus Kuba_, Nov 18 2014
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[k_] := a[k] = Sum[Binomial[3*k-1, 3*j]*a[j]*a[k-j-1], {j, 0, k-1}]; Table[a[k], {k, 0, 13}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 28 2014 *)
author: Stan Richardson (stan(AT)maths.ed.ac.uk)
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 24 2003
